I don't see anything wrong with egui that would be causing this to happen. Rather, it's being caused by this call here to the function `winit::window::Window::set_ime_cursor_area`:

https://github.com/emilk/egui/blob/4d4cb3d20db0517e74ca6ab6d3b646f78fd8123b/crates/egui-winit/src/lib.rs#L819-L833

The Wayland implementation of that function is somehow triggering egui apps to repaint every time it's called. I'll try to get this fixed in winit.

issue.title: Fix continuous repaint on Wayland when TextEdit is focused or IME output is set

repository.name: egui
repository.description: egui: an easy-to-use immediate mode GUI in Rust that runs on both web and native

issue.body:
* Closes #4254

Changes egui-winit so that it calls `window.set_ime_cursor_area` when the IME rect changes or the user interacts with the application instead of calling it every time the app is rendered. This works around a winit bug that causes the app to continuously repaint under certain circumstances on Wayland.

Tested on Wayland and on X11 using the text edit in the egui_demo_app - no changes in IME functionality as far as I can tell. Untested on non-Linux platforms.

issue.title: IME visibility improvement and visible selection

repository.name: egui
repository.description: egui: an easy-to-use immediate mode GUI in Rust that runs on both web and native

issue.body:
**IME visibility improvement and visible selection**

I have made the IME indicator visible,
and I have improved it to the best of our ability so far.
However, we still need to continue improving it in the future.

Fix Issues: When `Multiline`, IME Rect is displayed far away.
Fix Issues: The IME is displayed once and after it is entered, the IME is not displayed.
Fix Issues: IME is not updated at the end of line when using `Singleline`.

* Related #4254
* Related #4269
* Related #4362 


**Remaining Issue :**
In `Deferred Viewport`, no 'input event' comes in `handle_platform_output()`. 
In `Immediated Viewport`, the `ROOT`'s 'input event' comes in `handle_platform_output()`.

Therefore, this is the best solution for now.
